data.title: Rebecca (Call) Gorham (1744-1812)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Compare DNA and explore genealogy for Rebecca (Call) Gorham born 1744 Charlestown, Massachusetts died 1812 Charlestown, Middlesex, Massachusetts, USA including ancestors + descendants + DNA connections + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Rebecca Gorham formerly Call

Born 14 May 1744 in Charlestown, Massachusetts

Ancestors

Daughter of Caleb Call and Rebecca (Stimson) Call

Sister of Ann (Call) Dalton and Elizabeth (Call) Bartlett

Wife of Nathaniel Gorham — married 6 Sep 1763 in Charleston, Suffolk County, Massachusetts

Descendants

Died 18 Nov 1812 at age 68 in Charlestown, Middlesex, Massachusetts, USA

Profile last modified 19 Apr 2022 | Created 11 Apr 2013

This page has been accessed 1,272 times.

Contents

1 Biography

1.1 Facts

2 Notes

3 Sources

Biography

Rebecca (Call) Gorham was born on 14 May 1744 in Charlestown, Massachusetts. Her parents were Caleb Call (1718 - 1780) and Rebecca (Stimson) Stimpson (1718 - 1765).

Her sister was Elizabeth (Call) Bartlett (1759 - 1833).

Rebecca married Nathaniel Gorham (1738 - 1796) on 6 Sep 1763 in Charleston, Suffolk County.

Their children were...

Mary (Gorham) Bartlett (1767 - 1832)

Ann (Gorham) Brooks (1771 - 1850)

Lydia (Gorham) Phillips (~1778 - 1856).

Rebecca died on 18 Nov 1812 in Charlestown aged 68.

Facts

She was born on May 14, 1744 in Charlestown, Massachusetts and died on November 18, 1812 in Charlestown, Massachusetts. She was the daughter of Caleb Call and Rebecca Stimson.[5] Nathaniel and Rebecca were the parents of nine children

Notes

Sources

Wikipedia:Nathaniel_Gorham

Wyman, Thos. B., Jr. Extracts From The Diary of Robert Calley of Charlestown, Mass. 1699-1765, The New England Historical & Genealogical Register (New England Historic Genealogical Society, Boston, Mass., 1862) Vol. 16, Page 36, Page 38
